DOC.brief_summary: This study aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of two treatments for dental hypersensitivity: cyanoacrylate (Super BonderÂ®) compared with use of low intensity laser treatment. As the cyanoacrylate is a lower cost treatment, the hypothesis in investigation is if this product is equally effective as the laser treatment.
DOC.brief_title: Cyanoacrylate and Laser and Dentin Sensitivity
DOC.criteria: 1. patients should be in good general and dental health; 2. present complaints of dental sensitivity to cold, sweet, acidic foods and brushing; 3. present complaints of pain in teeth located in different quadrants; 4. manifest pain or discomfort upon application of the triple syringe air jet; 5. not be in current use of desensitizing agents. 1. presence of extensive restorations and carious lesions in the sensitive teeth; 2. undergoing orthodontic treatment; 3. frequent use of analgesics, antidepressants and antiinflammatory drugs; 4. presence of gingival inflammation; 5. nonconsent of patient.
